intro: Betonica betoniciflora f. rosea, commonly known as the pink betony, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink or lavender flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
